intro: Galium thunbergii, commonly known as Thunberg's bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that release tiny seeds when mature. Galium thunbergii is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream sides.
